oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A study of enterohemorrhagic Escherichia coli in beef cow-calf herds in Mississippi and Nebraska
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schneider, L. G.
Stromberg, Z. R.
Lewis, G. L.
Moxley, R. A.
Smith, D. R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The objective of this study was to describe the probability of detecting seven serogroups of enterohemorrhagic Escherichia coli (EHEC-7) of public health importance in fecal samples from beef cow-calf herds and to identify explanatory factors.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2017; 188
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Copyright (c) 2017 American Association of Bovine Practitioners
